From the beginning, it is the industrial unions that have been recognised in connection with the settlement of disputes. The members of the Trades and Labour Councils, and the officials of the unions, are the representatives of Labour, just as we here are the representatives of our constituents. The men who desire a Special Tribunal to settle their troubles quickly now have an opportunity to get such a Tribunal. I hope and believe that this machinery will be availed of by the miners.
